name: Hyoscyamus
Relationship: Compare: BELLAD.; STRAM.; AGARIC.; GELS.; HYOS. HYDROBROM. SCOPOLAMINE HYDROBROMIDE. (Paralysis agitans; TREMORS OF DISSEMINATED SCLEROSIS. Sleeplessness and nervous agitation. Dry cough in phthisis. Similar in its effects to alcohol, both recent and remote. Corresponds to the effects of strong poisons introduced into or generated within the body. Symptoms of uraemia and acute nervous exhaustion. A remedy for shock. Third and fourth Dec. trituration. In physiological dosage (1-200 gr.) mania and chorea; insomnia. SCOPOLA (Japanese Belladonna) - chemically identical with Hyoscine. (Joyous delirium, licking of lips and smacking of mouth; sleepless; tries to get out of bed; sees cats, picks imaginary hairs, warms hands before imaginary fire, etc.)Antidotes: BELL.; CAMPH.

Mind: Talkative, obscene, lascivious mania, uncovers body; jealous, FOOLISH
Low, muttering speech; CONSTANT CARPHOLOGIA, DEEP STUPOR
Great hilarity; INCLINED TO LAUGH AT EVERYTHING
Delirium, with attempt to run away
Stool: Diarrhoea, colicky, pains; INVOLUNTARY, aggravated by mental excitement or during sleep
Head: Inflammation of brain, with unconsciousness; head is shaken to and fro
Feels light and confused
Vertigo as if intoxicated
Brain feels loose, fluctuating
Chest: DRY, SPASMODIC COUGH AT NIGHT , from itching in the throat, as if uvula were too long
Male: Lascivious; exposes his person; plays with genitals during fever

Abdomen: Colic, with vomiting, belching, hiccough screaming
Colic, as if abdomen would burst
Mouth: Tongue dry, red, cracked, stiff and immovable, protruded with difficulty; speech impaired
Female: During menses, convulsive movements, urinary flux and sweat
Extremities: Child sobs and cries without waking
PICKING AT BED-CLOTHES; plays with hands; reaches out for things
Epileptic attacks ending in deep sleep

details: Disturbs the nervous system profoundly. It is as if some diabolical force took possession of the brain and prevented its functions. It causes a perfect picture of MANIA OF A QUARRELSOME AND OBSCENE CHARACTER. Inclined to be unseemly and immodest in acts, gestures and expressions. Very talkative, and persists in stripping herself, or uncovering genitals. Is jealous, afraid of being poisoned, etc. Its symptoms also point to weakness and NERVOUS AGITATION; hence typhoid and other infections with COMA VIGIL. TREMULOUS WEAKNESS AND TWITCHING OF TENDONS. Subsultus tendinum. Muscular twitchings, spasmodic affections, generally with delirium. Non-inflammatory cerebral activity. TOXIC GASTRITIS.
